alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 08 at 12:31AM CDT until further notice by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEAST BROWN COUNTY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Brown. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1229 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms...east if Crosscut and north May...moving northeast at 10 mph. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... May. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 441 crossing Bledsoe Branch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
